author: Lawrence Yee
title: Most Memorable Grammys Dresses & Gowns | Variety
text:
Taylor Swift in 2015 Rihanna in 2015 
The sky was the limit for Whitney Houston at her first Grammys in this sky blue Travilla dress with a sparkling strap. 
Mariah Carey may be known now for her skin-tight, over-the-top looks, but at her first Grammys, she wore a simple LBD. 
Shania Twain definitely felt like a woman in this dazzling floor-length turtleneck gown designed by Marc Bouwer. 
Although butterflies would become one of Mariah Carey’s most recognizable motifs, Christina Aguilera donned this sparkling Versace number the year she won the best new artist award. 
Pop princess Britney Spears channeled old Hollywood glamour in this white Randolph Duke gown and an Oscar de la Renta fur stole. 
This plunging jungle print Versace dress made Jennifer Lopez a household name and cemented her place in the red carpet history books. 
Toni Braxton’s “dress” rivaled J.Lo’s as the most revealing in Grammy history. 
Christina Aguilera completely transformed herself the following year, wearing a racy lace-up dress and sporting multi-color cornrows. 
Artists showed a lot of skin in the early aughts. Here’s Sheryl Crow in a long duster coat, cowboy boots, and not much else. 
Alicia Keys wore this bizarre combination of a sari and jeans to the 2002 Grammys. 
Known for her revealing looks, Lil Kim’s satin dress left lil to the imagination. We doubt the tiny fur stole provided much warmth. 
Carrie Underwood wears mostly monochromatic gowns these days. We love the vibrant color print of this Zuhair Murad gown. 
Fergie reportedly called this canary yellow Calvin Klein column dress her “glass slipper.” She looked like a princess in it. 
Beyonce looked out of this world in a futuristic, silver and blue Elie Saab gown. 
Cher looked like she had gone through hell and back in this distressed, heavy gown. 
Rapper M.I.A. not only walked the Grammys red carpet while she was pregnant, the awards show actually fell on her due date. She wore a flouncy dress and flats for maximum comfort. 
Backstage, M.I.A. flaunted her baby bump even more in this sheer shirt and short skirt. 
Rihanna always turns it out at the Grammys, as she demonstrated in this regal high collared Elie Saab creation. 
Lady Gaga looked out of this world in this custom Giorgio Armani Prive dress, complete with star accessory. 
Rihanna turned heads again in this Jean Paul Gaultier gown with strategically placed bands. We can only imagine what the fitting was like! 
Nicki Minaj had us seeing spots in this leopard look and sky-high hair. 
Katy Perry (and then-husband Russell Brand) looked heavenly in this custom Armani gown complete with angel wings. 
Cee Lo dressed up as a giant muppet while performing with the Jim Henson creations on stage. 
Fergie flaunted her lady lumps in this bright orange, laser-cut, lace Roberto Cavalli gown. 
Cyndi Lauper looked like a cross between Bellatrix Lestrange and Michael Jackson. 
Katy Perry always goes the elegant route at the Grammys, exemplified by this breathtaking blue Elie Saab gown. Even her updo was color-coordinated. 
Nicki Minaj made a dramatic arrival a hooded Versace robe and a faux pope as her accessory. 
Jennifer Lopez had a leg up (or should we say leg out) on the wardrobe restrictions set by CBS in 2013. This body baring Anthony Vaccarello dress was simple, yet sexy. 
Florence Welch’s style is as unique as her voice. This green, studded, reptilian dress was definitely one-of-a-kind. 
No one could ever say Katy Perry’s style is one note, especially in this ethereal gown that looked like sheet music. 
This white lacy Michael Costello gown put the “Project Runway” alumni on the map. Beyonce has favored this sheer look in recent years. 
We’d be all smiles like Miranda Lambert in this custom red Pamella Roland gown. Just classic. 
Miley Cyrus showed off lots of skin in this Alexandre Vauthier creation. 
Madonna’s ornate bullfighter-inspired Givenchy get-up was very revealing from the back. Trust us on this one. 
Another sheer orange dress, this time courtesy of Joy Villa. The Latin songstress’ modesty was only preserved by a pair of pasties. 
Taylor Swift surprised everyone is this modern, ombre blue Elie Saab gown — a total departure from her typical red carpet look. Magenta Giuseppe Zanotti shoes added another pop of color. 
Rihanna saved the day in this voluminous pink Giambattista Valli dress. Image: REX/Shutterstock
